Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, lower portion of the body and feet of a goose walking left; on the right, a black dot. Underside and edges glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
This piece is possibly from the same krater as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.579 (CVA II Gr. Brit. 413 III H pl. XII nr 9).
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 57, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0952)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2934 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
